law.text:
On written request, a correctional officer may have expunged from any file the record of a formal complaint made against the correctional officer if:
the internal investigation unit that investigated the complaint:
exonerated the correctional officer of all charges in the complaint; or
determined that the charges were unsustained or unfounded; or
a hearing board acquitted the correctional officer, dismissed the action, or made a finding of not guilty; and
at least 3 years have passed since the final disposition by the correctional facility or hearing board.
